user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_ip_count_unlock:
```c
static void
MHD_ip_count_unlock (struct MHD_Daemon *daemon)
{
  mhd_assert (NULL == daemon->master);
#if defined(MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS) || defined(MHD_USE_W32_THREADS)
  MHD_mutex_unlock_chk_ (&daemon->per_ip_connection_mutex);
#else
  (void) daemon;
#endif
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
MHD_mutex_unlock_chk_ (&daemon->per_ip_connection_mutex);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in the shown fragment. The call is to a different function (MHD_mutex_unlock_chk_), so there is no direct recursion. A violation would occur only if MHD_mutex_unlock_chk_ (directly or indirectly via other functions) called MHD_ip_count_unlock, creating a recursive cycle (e.g. MHD_ip_count_unlock -> MHD_mutex_unlock_chk_ -> ... -> MHD_ip_count_unlock).
